item.title: Report X-2025011082
item.description:
Report X-2025011082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-26
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A driver brought this package to QA's attention after picking it up at FedEx Office, 8057 WEDGEWOOD LN N, MAPLE GROVE, MN. Driver said the FXO employee explained strange situation that occurred with the customer dropping it off. The customer allegedly tried to offer it with Class 9 diamonds on it, but the FXO employee refused to accept, so the customer left and came back later with the Class 9 diamonds removed. FXO employee accepted it at that time but told driver about this. Driver told QA. The DG Nav specialist opened it for inspection and found that it contains a solar generator classified as UN3480. While there is a small UN3480 printed on the box, the customer seems to have deliberately removed the Class 9 diamonds to render it undeclared. Customer's return address is a business in Florida, but the last name connected to his first name in FAST when searching the business address appears fake. The phone number listed on the Fedex label is fake.

item.title: Report X-2025011165
item.description:
Report X-2025011165

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IN THE DMP, THE PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 1 GALLON PLASTIC JUGS OF, TECHSPRAY ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL GENERAL PURPOSE CLEANER, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN1219; ISOPROPANOL; 3: II; 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 16 L). THE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED THE ALCOHOL INSIDE TO LEAK ONTO ALL INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS, PLUS THE OUTSIDE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INNER PACKING MATERIAL. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report E-2025010356
item.description:
Report E-2025010356

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When moving pallets of waste around in warehouse the warehouseman was trying to double stack a pallet onto another skid of drum and the pallet was not stable and the drum tipped over and fell off the pallet to the ground. This happened at 1530 ct. They though down some absorbent and the called for a response team that is located on sight to properly clean up the material. The facility is in containment so there was no threat to the environment. The team began the clean up and repacking of the damaged drum into an salvage drum for shipment. The absorbents and material that was collected was then packaged up to be disposed of in the proper manner. The clean up was completed at 1730 ct.

  • Description: DRIVER PICKED UP PACKAGE, WHEN UNLOADING THE PACKAGE, WE FOUND THE PACKAGE NEEDED TO BE TAPED AND FOUND TRIGGERING TERMS SUCH AS THE COMPANY NAME "TNT FIREWORKS" ON THE PACKAGE, AND WE WERE ABLE TO SEE THE CONTENTS DUE TO THE BOX BEING OPEN SLIGHTLY. WE CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK ABOUT IT AND THEY SAID TO STOP THE TRANSPORTATION OF THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2025010326
item.description:
Report E-2025010326

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When performing a facility inspection it was noticed that a dropped trailer had liquid dripping from it around 1530 ct. They the thorough down absorbent to prevent any spread of the material and to begin absorbing it. The facility has a emergency response team located on site and they began the process of cleaning it up. The trailer was unloaded and 3 drum appeared to be swell up and the material was being pushed out of the bungs. The material consisted of mostly water and the drums had frozen causing the expansion. The team released the pressure and placed them into salvage drums. The rest of the material was then cleaned up and disposed of in the appropriate manner. The clean up was completed by 1730 ct. approximately 1 gallon was released.
